title: In Tribute to Lena Fitting-Kourkoutis - The Path to Cryo-Lift-Out for Sensitive Biological or “Other” Soft and Fragile Matter
content: We have known Lena from 2010 when she applied for a Humboldt fellowship and later on joined the Department of Molecular Structural Biology at the Max Planck Institute of Biochemistry (MPIB) in Martinsried for a "Cryo-Year". Her particular aim was to learn the intricacies of sample preparation for cryo-TEM in order to transfer the experience gained to cryo-STEM on soft matter respectively on liquid-solid interfaces. She joined a crowd of people that alike her came from different backgrounds, just to name a few: Elizabeth Villa, Julia Mahamid, Radostin Danev, Alexander Rigort and us (JP and WB). And Lena was determined to make "life in cryo" usable for materials science, which she later impressively demonstrated.
